sentences.sContent: I’m going to show you how to make a box for your tools.
sentences.sCn: 我来教你怎么做一个箱子存放工具。

sentences.sContent: A family of mice had made their nest in the roof.
sentences.sCn: 一窝老鼠在屋顶上安了家。

sentences.sContent: She made her own wedding dress.
The company has been making quality furniture for over 200 years.
sentences.sCn: 这家公司制作优质家具有两百多年的历史了。

sentences.sContent: They met while they were making a film.
sentences.sCn: 他们是在拍电影时认识的。

sentences.sContent: Make a list of all the things you need.
sentences.sCn: 把你需要的所有物品列一份清单。

sentences.sContent: ...she knew she had to make a bold move to fully commit to her new future...
...Viewing the past in high definition can make it very difficult to get over pain and regret...
...Readiness to take advantage of new opportunities will make it easier to create one’s desired future...
...When it’s time to make the leap...
...Initially Leah stayed with her accounting job while starting up the yoga studio to make it all work...
...People with HSAM often have to make efforts to avoid focusing on the past...
...Dogs may have learned to detect threat signs from humans and respond by trying to make peace...
...and make it much harder than it needs to be...
...it is wise for the parents to set an example rather than make demands...
...patients can make allowance for them friendly for their good relationship...

synos.tran: 使得；进行；布置，准备，整理；制造；认为；获得；形成；安排；引起；构成

phrases.pCn: 理解；辨认出；说明；填写；设法应付
求活；创造人生；有意义的活

words.tran: 制造者；造物主；出期票人
做，使，安排（make的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: to produce something, for example by putting the different parts of it together
